title: Common Design-Based Network Operation Strategies for Scaling Educational Reform Models

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational education policy knowledge and science curriculum design experience
context.additional_context: A course emphasizing the establishment of a network model for educational innovation in science, requiring collaboration and project execution using digital devices.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze and explain core elements of network-based educational models (common design, central support systems, etc.).
Learners can identify policy and organizational barriers occurring during the expansion of educational reform models and propose solutions.

Learners can develop one project-based assessment tool for science curriculum design within a six-month course, apply it at least once in an actual classroom setting, and achieve over 70% satisfaction in learner feedback surveys.
Learners can establish and execute common design-based operational strategies in large-scale learner environments.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
